intro: Hedyotis elatinoides, commonly known as small-leaved bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems covered with fine, appressed hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters along the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Hedyotis elatinoides thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
